title: Warren Rewrites Her Story Again
text:
‘I am sorry for harm I have caused,” Sen. Elizabeth Warren told the Frank LaMere Native American Presidential Forum in August, referring to her false claims of Indian heritage. Now she’s under fire for another evident embellishment.

Asked at last month’s debate to describe her “most significant professional setback,” she cited the loss of her first teaching job, in 1971. “At the end of that first year, I was visibly pregnant,” she said. “Back in the day, that meant that the principal . . . wished me luck and hired someone...
description: Official records contradict her claim that she was fired for pregnancy in 1971.
